content:
The most common cause of folk posting questions like you have is because they have elected to use IMAP to manage their mail and the service provider either auto archives or deletes old mail after a set time frame. So can we start by confirming you are indeed using IMAP?

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/difference-between-imap-and-pop3
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Just a guess here: I think you may be looking below the response. Instead, look at bottom of entire message, as that is where you specified it to appear.

content: I’ve tried using it twice and do not believe it’s actually working. Nothing seems to be running correctly. Have Windows 11 and McAffee. creator: carol60411

content:
ver 146 upgraded the profile. You may do better by reverting to prior version. Try: 

   Exit Thunderbird if running.    click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

Then click settings and se the update option to manual instead of automatic.
creator: davidsk

content: Just a suggestion: make sure that cookies are accepted at settings>privacy&security. Then, start over for the setup and do NOT enter password, but wait for the Google prompt.
